channel.title: Maddie Peterson's Github Site
channel.description: Recent content on Maddie Peterson's Github Site

item.title: Is third down performance a major factor in winning games?
item.description: When watching a football game, third downs are a time when energy is high throughout the stadium. It’s a pivotal moment in a game. Performance on third downs decides whether a team will punt it away, kick a field goal or keep driving down the field. But how much does converting on third downs contribute to wins? Does a team that converts more on third downs make a better team?

item.title: Worst Games in College Football Last Season
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.3 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.0.5 ✓ dplyr 1.0.3 ## ✓ tidyr 1.1.2 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 1.4.0 ✓ forcats 0.5.0 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(ggalt) ## Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'ggalt': ## method from ## grid.draw.absoluteGrob ggplot2 ## grobHeight.

item.title: About Maddie Peterson
item.description: As a sophomore majoring in Sports Media and Communication and Advertising and Public Relations at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln, I’ve learned that there is a wide variety of opportunities within those industries. From public speaking, to coding, to creating campaigns, to making videos– I have been able to dip my toes into just about every area throughout my college experience thus far. I also have continued to seek out real-world experiences through jobs and internships that have helped me continuously learn and gain experience.
